instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.U7090: What is U7090? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V42_G3H.
definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.message: initially this computer did not turn on a green light then change <CHIP>U7090</CHIP> because 2.2v l7095 g3hot, this board  after change ic l7095=3.3v not 3.42, I do not know if it's normal valor.customer took the laptop now the client brought me the laptop with the same problem I measure it gives me 2.2v l7095,  change <CHIP>U7090</CHIP> and measure l7095= 3.37 and power on again.I do not know that value is normal or there is other damage board or customer is doing something wrong

Can you confirm the real code of your board?

Something reacts to heat in that area.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> A Something reacts to heat in that area?

You've said the board started after worked on <CHIP>U7090</CHIP> area.
If goes bad again, after a while, we can suppose heat reaction affecting some component.

Remove <CAPACITOR>C7095</CAPACITOR>, replace <CAPACITOR>C7094</CAPACITOR> and <RESISTOR>R7095</RESISTOR>/96.
refers to the heat when change the ic <CHIP>U7090</CHIP> with my air station can affect other components? with what temperature and air to change components with quick861dw?

The heat may affect some component, which works for short time after that.
Could also be caused by accumulated crap under some BGA chip.

Each hot air station has its settings, which you can adjust testing with scrap boards.
Yes, remove it; to discard possible leakage issue.

ok it's fine after changes  <CAPACITOR>C7094</CAPACITOR> <RESISTOR>R7095</RESISTOR>,<RESISTOR>R7096</RESISTOR>  the 3.42v.But it had sulfated resistance and capacitor,near the smc <RESISTOR>R5699</RESISTOR>, <CAPACITOR>C5449</CAPACITOR> then replace. now it starts but an asd error appears ASD fail sensor ICOR and ISDC  I do not know if it was my error or dirt was placed under the smc before I did not have that error

Check the circuits related with mentioned sensors.
You should reball SMC, if found corrosion so close.
